channel.title: ricochet support
channel.description: Hello. Whonix 14 kvm ricochet seem not to be working. I used wiki instructions but gateway prints messages [rejecting anonymous request for connection to private address on transport natdport. Possible loop in nat rules?].Workstation says online but I am not sure..

item.title: ricochet support
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
As per answer in above ticket, Ricochet Refresh I guess it is safe to predict that Ricochet Refresh will stay non-freedom software.

Whonix documentation updated just now:
Ricochet IM

Read full topic

item.title: ricochet support
item.dc:creator: TNT_BOM_BOM
item.description:
github.com/blueprint-freespeech/ricochet-refresh

Ricochet-Refresh is now proprietary

opened 07:51AM - 14 May 22 UTC
TNTBOMBOM

Hi, I saw the license have been [switched to Commons Clause](https://github.…com/blueprint-freespeech/ricochet-refresh/commit/b0a274c07f0e8afd7b6727e3fe8428e1f9ad5249) which is [non-free license due to its restrictions](https://www.gnu.org/licenses/license-list.html#comclause). [Here](https://www.ricochetrefresh.net/#About): "Ricochet Refresh uses the original Ricochet open-source software but has improved on it substantially, such as upgrading its security and making it compatible with Tor Onion Services v3 instead of the older v2." And switched its license to proprietary one, or "but has degraded its license".. Sad switch, Cant use ricochet anymore..

Read full topic

item.title: ricochet support
item.dc:creator: JeremyRand
item.description:
Hi Patrick, sorry for the delayed reply. I don’t know what the hell is going on at Ricochet/Blueprint, but as of 2022 April 30, they are no longer Freedom Software. This has burned my trust in them as a contributor, and I won’t be sending them any patches in the future. Very disappointing; I honestly do not know what chat application I would recommend instead at this point.

EDIT: Gosling is also non-freedom.

Read full topic

item.title: ricochet support
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Patrick:

This has been figured out and fixed thanks to @JeremyRand!

github.com/blueprint-freespeech/ricochet-refresh

Read Tor control port/host/passwd from env vars

blueprint-freespeech:development ← JeremyRand:control-port-env

opened Jul 1, 2021

JeremyRand

+32 -0

Mostly copied verbatim from fe8f24aad1779cc798926d980f55f81b52f71683; seems to h…ave been accidentally removed in e6f1c194e80c58946b3feeecdb09c795582e5f19 (which was supposed to only remove settings file code, not environment variable code). With this PR applied, I was able to successfully use Ricochet-Refresh with the system Tor provided by Whonix’s anon-ws-disable-stacked-tor package.

github.com/blueprint-freespeech/ricochet-refresh

Fix listen IP address on Workstation/Gateway setups

Unfortunately the pull request was not merged.

So I’m trying to do as little code churn in Ricochet-Refresh as possible until the backend is replaced with Gosling. We have a ticket tracking this sort of thing here: blueprint-freespeech/gosling#5

As discussed in #101 all work in this space should happen in Gosling. See: #101

I don’t understand. You? @JeremyRand

Read full topic

item.title: ricochet support
item.dc:creator: bill
item.description:
They haven’t put out a release since June 2021. I guess we’re waiting for the next release to incorporate some of the issues @Patrick linked to above.

I had problems getting the current release to work reliably in Whonix.

Read full topic

item.title: ricochet support
item.dc:creator: whonixfriend
item.description:
Hi, I have been looking at Ricochet Refresh (https://www.ricochetrefresh.net) lately. To me it looks very promising - especially with the file sharing option. Has anyone been playing around with it in whonix yet? And is there a known way to use it safely with whonix?

Read full topic

item.title: ricochet support
item.dc:creator: bill
item.description:
Is there a good way to install Ricochet Refresh on Whonix 16 (on Qubes 4.04) that avoids the Tor over Tor scenario? The new Ricochet includes its own copy of Tor and I’d prefer not to use that.

Ricochet Refresh

Ricochet Refresh

A Blueprint For Free speech initiative to update and improve Ricochet

Read full topic

item.title: ricochet support
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Remove Ricochet from Whonix

Removed since no longer working in Whonix 15 despite all efforts.

This has been figured out and fixed thanks to @JeremyRand!

github.com/blueprint-freespeech/ricochet-refresh

Read Tor control port/host/passwd from env vars

blueprint-freespeech:development ← JeremyRand:control-port-env
opened 10:15PM - 01 Jul 21 UTC
JeremyRand
+32 -0

Mostly copied verbatim from fe8f24aad1779cc798926d980f55f81b52f71683; seems to h…ave been accidentally removed in e6f1c194e80c58946b3feeecdb09c795582e5f19 (which was supposed to only remove settings file code, not environment variable code). With this PR applied, I was able to successfully use Ricochet-Refresh with the system Tor provided by Whonix's `anon-ws-disable-stacked-tor` package.

github.com/blueprint-freespeech/ricochet-refresh

Fix listen IP address on Workstation/Gateway setups

blueprint-freespeech:development ← JeremyRand:workstation-listen
opened 12:02AM - 02 Jul 21 UTC
JeremyRand
+7 -0

Without this PR, connections fail if both peers are using Whonix; with this PR, …such connections now work. (Both tests done with https://github.com/blueprint-freespeech/ricochet-refresh/pull/101 applied.)

So once that is merged and there’s a new ricochet release, ricochet might be again functional inside Whonix.

This also opens the door for considering to re-install ricochet by default inside Whonix if/when ricochet hits the next Debian stable.

Read full topic

item.title: ricochet support
item.dc:creator: sheep
item.description:
HulaHoop:

cwtch is promising as a successor but I won’t hold my breath over a Debian package. She releases Docker containers though which are difficult to integrate because you can’t really update them as securely as packages.

I just see you already mentioned it.

Read full topic

item.title: ricochet support
item.dc:creator: sheep
item.description:
As detailed below, the developer mentions many issues with ricochet

github.com/ricochet-im/ricochet

Issue: Please @special do something

opened by cypherbits on 2019-05-27 
Ricochet is used by many people, please, update the project. It's just a few hours of work.
@special @s-rah

and moved to work on cwtch

openprivacy.ca

Cwtch

The Open Privacy Research Society is a non-profit Canadian group based in Vancouver, British Columbia. We believe that moral systems enable consent. Our society exists to invent, create, build, test, publish, deploy, promote, and to encourage the...

Cwtch is an extension of the metadata resistant protocol Ricochet to support asynchronous, multi-peer group communications through the use of discardable, untrusted, anonymous infrastructure.

Anyone tried it?

There’s also https://ricochetrefresh.net/, an attempt by others to revive ricochet.

Read full topic

item.title: ricochet support
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Done.

github.com/Whonix/anon-meta-packages

remove ricochet-im, coyim since non-functional 

https://github.com/coyim/coyim/issues/527
https://forums.whonix.org/t/ricochet-support/7174/46
by adrelanos on 09:46AM - 08 Jun 19 UTC
changed 1 files with 1 additions and 1 deletions.

Read full topic

item.title: ricochet support
item.dc:creator: HulaHoop
item.description:
Good find. Then there is nothing we can do to fix it in this situation. I nominate it for removal in the next point release (though keep the onion-grater profie around becuase it isn’t visible or takes up space) as keeping broken software will give a bad impression of the distro.

cwtch is promising as a successor but I won’t hold my breath over a Debian package. She releases Docker containers though which are difficult to integrate because you can’t really update them as securely as packages.

Read full topic

item.title: ricochet support
item.dc:creator: TNT_BOM_BOM
item.description:
Ricochet main issue is with Tor 3.x on both sides, as there cant be connection happening between 2 Ricochets connected to Tor 3.x (according to my test) Other ppl tested that as well:

github.com/privacytoolsIO/privacytools.io

Issue: Add a warning to the Ricochet description

opened by ghost on 2018-05-29 
ricochet-im/ricochet#579
It's already dead.

Thats mean either we patch Ricochet , or wait for someone in couple of years or deprecate it.

Read full topic

item.title: ricochet support
item.dc:creator: HulaHoop
item.description:
No. Ricochet is online (always was) but it can’t see that someone added it.

Read full topic

item.title: ricochet support
item.dc:creator: HulaHoop
item.description:
Log output after adding contact. (Not much to work with or understand what’s happening):

user@host:~$ sudo -u onion-grater /usr/lib/onion-grater --debug --listen-interface eth1 --complain
IP address for interface eth1 : 10.152.152.10
Tor control port filter started, listening on 10.152.152.10:9051
Serving Thread started
10.152.152.11:53598 (filter: 30_autogenerated) connected: loaded filter: 30_autogenerated
Final rules:
commands:
  ADD_ONION:
  - {pattern: 'NEW:(\S+) Port=9878,\S+:(\S+)', replacement: 'NEW:{} Port=9878,{client-address}:{}'}
  - {pattern: '(\S+):(\S+) Port=9878,\S+:(\S+)', replacement: '{}:{} Port=9878,{client-address}:{}'}
  DEL_ONION:
  - {pattern: .+}
  GETCONF:
  - {pattern: DisableNetwork}
  - {pattern: (__owningcontrollerprocess)}
  GETINFO:
  - {pattern: status/circuit-established}
  - {pattern: version}
  - pattern: net/listeners/socks
    response:
    - {pattern: 250-net/listeners/socks=".*", replacement: '250-net/listeners/socks="127.0.0.1:9150"'}
  - {pattern: consensus/valid-after}
  - {pattern: consensus/valid-until}
  - {pattern: consensus/fresh-until}
  - pattern: status/circuit-established status/bootstrap-phase net/listeners/socks
    response:
    - {pattern: 250-status/bootstrap-phase=*, replacement: 250-status/bootstrap-phase=NOTICE
        BOOTSTRAP PROGRESS=100 TAG=done SUMMARY="Done"}
    - {pattern: 250-net/listeners/socks=".*", replacement: '250-net/listeners/socks="127.0.0.1:9150"'}
  SIGNAL:
  - {pattern: NEWNYM}
events:
  CONF_CHANGED: {suppress: true}
  SIGNAL: {suppress: true}
  STATUS_CLIENT: {suppress: true}
  STATUS_SERVER: {suppress: true}
restrict-stream-events: false

    250-net/listeners/socks="127.0.0.1:9050" "10.152.152.10:9050" "10.152.152.10:9100" "10.152.152.10:9101" "10.152.152.10:9102" "10.152.152.10:9103" "10.152.152.10:9104" "10.152.152.10:9105" "10.152.152.10:9106" "10.152.152.10:9107" "10.152.152.10:9108" "10.152.152.10:9109" "10.152.152.10:9110" "10.152.152.10:9111" "10.152.152.10:9112" "10.152.152.10:9113" "10.152.152.10:9114" "10.152.152.10:9115" "10.152.152.10:9116" "10.152.152.10:9117" "10.152.152.10:9118" "10.152.152.10:9119" "10.152.152.10:9120" "10.152.152.10:9121" "10.152.152.10:9122" "10.152.152.10:9123" "10.152.152.10:9124" "10.152.152.10:9125" "10.152.152.10:9150" "10.152.152.10:9152" "10.152.152.10:9153" "10.152.152.10:9154" "10.152.152.10:9155" "10.152.152.10:9156" "10.152.152.10:9157" "10.152.152.10:9158" "10.152.152.10:9159" "10.152.152.10:9160" "10.152.152.10:9161" "10.152.152.10:9162" "10.152.152.10:9163" "10.152.152.10:9164" "10.152.152.10:9165" "10.152.152.10:9166" "10.152.152.10:9167" "10.152.152.10:9168" "10.152.152.10:9169" "10.152.152.10:9170" "10.152.152.10:9171" "10.152.152.10:9172" "10.152.152.10:9173" "10.152.152.10:9174" "10.152.152.10:9175" "10.152.152.10:9176" "10.152.152.10:9177" "10.152.152.10:9178" "10.152.152.10:9179" "10.152.152.10:9180" "10.152.152.10:9181" "10.152.152.10:9182" "10.152.152.10:9183" "10.152.152.10:9184" "10.152.152.10:9185" "10.152.152.10:9186" "10.152.152.10:9187" "10.152.152.10:9188" "10.152.152.10:9189" "127.0.0.1:9100" "127.0.0.1:9101" "127.0.0.1:9102" "127.0.0.1:9103" "127.0.0.1:9104" "127.0.0.1:9105" "127.0.0.1:9106" "127.0.0.1:9107" "127.0.0.1:9108" "127.0.0.1:9109" "127.0.0.1:9110" "127.0.0.1:9111" "127.0.0.1:9112" "127.0.0.1:9113" "127.0.0.1:9114" "127.0.0.1:9115" "127.0.0.1:9116" "127.0.0.1:9117" "127.0.0.1:9118" "127.0.0.1:9119" "127.0.0.1:9120" "127.0.0.1:9121" "127.0.0.1:9122" "127.0.0.1:9123" "127.0.0.1:9124" "127.0.0.1:9125" "127.0.0.1:9150" "unix:/var/run/tor/socks"

item.title: ricochet support
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
HulaHoop:

How do I disable onion-grater filtering altogether and see if it will work?

Please try this on Whonix-Gateway.

sudo systemctl stop onion-grater
sudo -u onion-grater /usr/lib/onion-grater --debug --listen-interface eth1 --complain

Read full topic

item.title: ricochet support
item.dc:creator: HulaHoop
item.description:
How do I disable onion-grater filtering altogether and see if it will work? Just to see if we are looking in the right place.

All Tor related commands are in these files in case you can easily notice what we miss out on.

  • https://github.com/ricochet-im/ricochet/blob/master/src/tor/

Read full topic

item.title: ricochet support
item.dc:creator: HulaHoop
item.description:
The only explanation left is onion-grater is not passing something thru related to adding contacts.

Read full topic

item.title: ricochet support
item.dc:creator: HulaHoop
item.description:
Upgraded apparmor profiles once again, tested on cloned setup. Doesn’t work. Checked apparmor status with aa-status: Ricochet not even enforced. Apparmor not the culprit.

Read full topic

item.title: ricochet support
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
HulaHoop via Whonix Forum:

Installed updated apparmor pkg.

Not sure the package was already build and uploaded by that time.
Perhaps in the Whonix 15 developers repository. Usually if I don’t
notify package built and upload, can be assumed it’s not the case yet.
The longer there is no notification, the more likely it was done.

Did you verify that you have these changes on the disk?

Pushed to all Whonix 15 repositories now.

Waiting for someone with the new setup to test with.

Possible to test against yourself by using a second Whonix-Workstation?
That worked for me during development back then. That would eliminate
coordinating with someone else.

Read full topic

item.title: ricochet support
item.dc:creator: HulaHoop
item.description:
Installed updated apparmor pkg. Waiting for someone with the new setup to test with.

Read full topic

item.description:

ricochet apparmor profile fixes 

thanks to @HulaHoopWhonix for the bug report!

changed 1 files with 3 additions and 2 deletions.
